title: Pasta Carbonara
instructions:
Cook the spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente. 
 In a separate pan, cook the pancetta until crispy. In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, grated Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper. Drain the cooked spaghetti and return it to the pan. Add the cooked pancetta and the egg mixture to the spaghetti. 
 Toss everything together until the eggs are cooked by the residual heat and form a creamy sauce. 
 Serve hot and garnish with additional grated Parmesan cheese, if desired.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions:
Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F). 
 In a large bowl, cream together the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract. 
 In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture and mix until just combined. Stir in the chocolate chips. 
 Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets. 
 Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheets for a few minutes, then transfer them to wire racks to cool completely. 
 Enjoy!

title: Beef Stew
instructions:
1. In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. 
2. Season the beef chuck with salt, pepper, and flour. 
3. Brown the beef in the pot until all sides are well-seared. Remove and set aside. 
4. In the same pot, add chopped onions and minced garlic. Sauté until onions are translucent.
5. Add tomato paste and cook for a minute. 
6. Pour in red wine and scrape the bottom of the pot to release any browned bits. 
7. Add beef broth, carrots, potatoes, thyme, and bay leaves. 
8. Return the beef to the pot and bring the stew to a boil. 
9. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 2-3 hours until the beef is tender and the flavors have melded together. 
10. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper as needed. 
11. Serve hot and enjoy!

title: Grilled Cheese Sandwich
instructions:
1. Butter one side of each slice of bread. 
 2. Place cheese in between the slices. 
3. Heat a pan over medium heat. 
4. Place the sandwich in the pan and cook until golden brown on both sides.

title: Chicken Caesar Salad
instructions:
1. Grill or bake chicken until cooked through. 
2. Cut lettuce into bite-size pieces and place in a bowl. 
 3. Add sliced chicken, grated Parmesan cheese, croutons, and Caesar dressing. 
4. Toss until well combined.

title: Omelette
instructions:
1. Beat eggs with milk, salt, and pepper. 
2. Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat. 
3. Pour the egg mixture into the pan. 
4. When the eggs begin to set, sprinkle cheese over one half of the omelette. 
5. Use a spatula to fold the other half over the cheese. 
6. Cook until the cheese is melted and the eggs are cooked through.

title: Margherita Pizza
instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to the highest temperature. 
2. Roll out the pizza dough into a round shape. 
3. Place the dough on a baking sheet. 
4. Spread a thin layer of olive oil on the dough. 
5. Slice the tomatoes and mozzarella cheese, and arrange them on the dough. 
6. Sprinkle with salt and torn basil leaves. 
7. Bake in the preheated oven until the crust is golden and the cheese is melted and bubbly.

title: Guacamole
instructions:
1. Cut avocados in half and remove the pit. 
2. Scoop the flesh into a bowl and mash with a fork. 
3. Add chopped tomato, finely chopped onion, lime juice, chopped cilantro, and salt. 
4. Mix well and adjust seasoning to taste.

title: Baked Salmon
instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F. 
2. Place the salmon on a baking sheet. 
3. Melt butter in a small saucepan and add minced garlic, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. 
4. Pour the mixture over the salmon. 
5. Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through.
